title: There will be memory leaks as follows for multiple show() dismiss() of the same Dialog in an Activity
body:
```
    ====================================
    HEAP ANALYSIS RESULT
    ====================================
    1 APPLICATION LEAKS
    
    References underlined with "~~~" are likely causes.
    Learn more at https://squ.re/leaks.
    
    3027 bytes retained by leaking objects
    Signature: cfe388748ece2d3337e096d8ac6c8f88a62720
    ┬───
    │ GC Root: System class
    │
    ├─ leakcanary.internal.InternalLeakCanary class
    │    Leaking: NO (TestActivity↓ is not leaking and a class is never leaking)
    │    ↓ static InternalLeakCanary.resumedActivity
    ├─ com.xxxxxxx.example.TestActivity instance
    │    Leaking: NO (Activity#mDestroyed is false)
    │    mApplication instance of com.xxxxxxx.example.App
    │    mBase instance of android.app.ContextImpl
    │    ↓ TestActivity.dialog$delegate
    │                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    ├─ kotlin.SynchronizedLazyImpl instance
    │    Leaking: UNKNOWN
    │    Retaining 53.0 kB in 848 objects
    │    ↓ SynchronizedLazyImpl._value
    │                           ~~~~~~
    ├─ com.xxxxxxx.loading.LoadingDialog instance
    │    Leaking: UNKNOWN
    │    Retaining 53.0 kB in 847 objects
    │    mContext instance of com.xxxxxxx.example.TestActivity with mDestroyed = false
    │    mContext instance of android.view.ContextThemeWrapper, wrapping activity com.xxxxxxx.example.TestActivity with
    │    mDestroyed = false
    │    Dialog#mDecor is null
    │    ↓ Dialog.mWindow
    │             ~~~~~~~
    ├─ com.android.internal.policy.PhoneWindow instance
    │    Leaking: UNKNOWN
    │    Retaining 4.5 kB in 19 objects
    │    mContext instance of android.view.ContextThemeWrapper, wrapping activity com.xxxxxx.example.TestActivity with
    │    mDestroyed = false
    │    Window#mDestroyed is false
    │    ↓ PhoneWindow.mDecor
    │                  ~~~~~~
    ╰→ com.android.internal.policy.DecorView instance
    ​     Leaking: YES (ObjectWatcher was watching this because com.android.internal.policy.DecorView received
    ​     View#onDetachedFromWindow() callback)
    ​     Retaining 3.0 kB in 55 objects
    ​     key = 92ac42a0-ae93-4b9f-996d-12645fd7616f
    ​     watchDurationMillis = 5072
    ​     retainedDurationMillis = 69
    ​     key = 27c08f62-5766-4f1e-92f4-c49bd5ef9780
    ​     watchDurationMillis = 21929
    ​     retainedDurationMillis = 16925
    ​     key = 3a9614b8-f692-44a8-861b-ddff46a5b549
    ​     watchDurationMillis = 5073
    ​     retainedDurationMillis = 70
    ​     key = 0218d899-ab82-4294-93e6-f522b17131cc
    ​     watchDurationMillis = 21930
    ​     retainedDurationMillis = 16926
    ​     key = 1cde30b9-03da-490b-aaae-7c5fc506d36e
    ​     key = af627318-23ef-4725-968d-befd0a2b9610
    ​     watchDurationMillis = 35424
    ​     retainedDurationMillis = 30417
    ​     View not part of a window view hierarchy
    ​     View.mAttachInfo is null (view detached)
    ​     View.mWindowAttachCount = 3
    ​     mContext instance of android.view.ContextThemeWrapper, wrapping activity com.xxxxxxx.example.TestActivity with
    ​     mDestroyed = false
    ====================================
```
